subject: Re: Fw: Fw: Eptec External Web Page - Policy

full_threads.body:
Request:
Client requested the following updates to the website:
  • Position HSEQ between Solutions and Industries in the top navigation
  • Remove Safety under the About Us section

Action Taken:
  • HSEQ added between Solutions and Industries as requested
  • Safety removed from the About Us section
  • Verified placement and functionality on the live site
  • Noted that the screenshot provided showed a slightly different HSEQ position; confirmed with the client

Conclusion:
All requested updates are now live on the website. Client confirmed that the placement of HSEQ is perfect.

Hi Marcelo

Thanks for the quick turnaround.

HSEQ is perfect where it is.

Have a great day.

Thanks

Fransie Bloem

​​​​

IT Operations Manager



Eptec Group

Hi Fransie,

Hope you're doing well. Thank you for providing the updates and clarifications! We really appreciate the detailed instructions.

We’ve made the requested changes and they are now live on your website:

  • HSEQ has been positioned between Solutions and Industries as requested,
  • Safety has been removed under the About Us section.

Just to clarify — we’ve placed HSEQ between Solutions and Industries as requested, but the screenshot you provided shows it in a slightly different position. Could you confirm if the placement on the live site is correct?

Everything is now live and up to date! If there’s anything else you’d like us to tweak or adjust, just let me know — I’m always happy to help.

Thank you Fransie, appreciated!

Tertius de Vries

Hi Marcelo Thank you very much for the HSEQ Changes. Please publish the HSEQ changes after doing the below minor changes to be our new external web page.
  • Please move HSSEQ to be in-between Solutions and Industries on the top line.
CURRENT NEW
  • Please remove safety under "About Us"
Thanks Fransie Bloem ​​​​ IT Operations Manager Eptec Group | Head Office 2/7 Luke Street , Lytton , QLD , 4178 | Australia M: +61 417 787 412 E: fbloem@eptec.com.au | W: www.eptec.com.au Defence and Infrastructure, Asset Remediation & Corrosion Mitigation Solutions This email, including any attachments, is confidential and may be legally privileged (and neither is waived or lost by mistaken delivery). @allieB Closing this ticket for now, as we’re still waiting on the client’s response. We’ll reopen or update once we hear back.

Ticket / Issue

The ticket relates to the finalization and publishing of the HSSEQ pages on the Eptec website. Tertius requested activation of Fransie Bloem’s access to coordinate, review, and comment on the pages. The client also proposed a main menu drop-down structure for HSEQ and provided a new ISO 19443 certificate to be uploaded. During review, an older/different certification was noticed under the About Us section, and clarification is needed on whether it should be updated.

Key points:
  • Activation of new user access for Fransie Bloem.
  • Publishing and structuring of HSSEQ pages with drop-down menu.
  • Upload of ISO 19443 certificate.
  • Existing certification under About Us may need updating.

Action Plan

The following actions have been completed or are in progress:
  • User Access: Fransie Bloem (fbloem@eptec.com.au) granted privileges to coordinate, review, and comment on the pages.
  • HSSEQ Pages: Published with HSEQ drop-down menu containing:
    • Policies
    • Zero Harm System
    • Environmental, Social & Governance
    • Certifications
    • Zero Harm Journey

  • ISO 19443 Certificate: Uploaded and titled ISO 19443:2025.
  • Review Materials: Screenshots and page updates shared via Google Docs link.
  • About Us Certification: Noted older/different version; awaiting client confirmation on whether to replace with new ISO 19443 certificate.

Conclusion

All requested changes to the HSSEQ pages and access configurations have been completed successfully.

The only pending item is client confirmation regarding the replacement or update of the certification under About Us. The team is ready to implement any further adjustments as required.

Hi Tertius,

I’m happy to confirm that all the requested changes to the HSSEQ pages have been completed and are ready for review. Below is a summary:

Updates implemented:

  • HSEQ drop-down menu added on the main page with the following items:
    • Policies
    • Zero Harm System
    • Environmental, Social & Governance
    • Certifications
    • Zero Harm Journey


  • ISO 19443 certificate uploaded and titled: ISO 19443:2025


  • New user access activated for Fransie Bloem (fbloem@eptec.com.au) with updated privileges to coordinate, review, and comment on the pages as required.
    • View the link here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1qsxHEUB5M3Nrm2PIao6F7b8pmCre5lUBBtsIGGHk6n8/edit?usp=sharing

Additionally, we noticed there’s an different version of a certification listed under the About Us section. Would you like us to replace that page with the new certification page you provided, or should we leave the existing content as is?

Please let us know if there’s anything else you’d like us to adjust. Always happy to help!

Hi Marcelo,

Her first name and surname are Fransie Bloem with e-mail fbloem@eptec.com.au

I have attached the ISO Certificate for you.

Stay safe!

Tertius

Tertius de Vries

Hi Tertius,

Thank you for your message! I'm filling in for joy regarding this request.

Before we can proceed, could you please confirm the first and last name and email address we should use to set up Fransie’s access?

Following that, our team will:
  • Activate Fransie’s access so she can coordinate, review, and comment on the pages
  • Publish the HSSEQ pages with the proposed drop-down menu
  • Upload the new ISO 19443 certificate (pending confirmation from Mark)

Once all confirmations are received, we’ll proceed with the changes and update you as soon as everything is finalized.

If you need anything else in the meantime, please don’t hesitate to reach out — we’re always happy to help!

action.text: Marcelo Meneses assigned to Marcelo Meneses

Good morning, Joy, Glad to inform you that Fransie is back on deck and will manage this initiative to ensure we get the webpage finalised and published. Can you please activate her access to the page to enable her to coordinate, review and comment as required. As per prior e-mails, I am confirming that the HSEQ pages are looking great and I would like for it to be published as discussed please. Proposing we add it as a title on the main page with a drop down as follow: HSEQ
  • Policies
  • Zero Harm System
  • Environmental, Social & Governance
  • Certifications
  • Zero Harm Journey
Mark, Please provide the new ISO 19443 certificate to be uploaded. Stay safe!
